items.content_html: Feeling recovered from last week. Got out for 20 miles on my run, then watched the Elm Creek Backyard Ultra participants finish yard 24 (100 miles). 13 met that mark, then 7 continued on 🏃

items.content_html: Checked out four different local parks with my son to stack rank for his upcoming birthday party. The rain was not an issue and we now have a clear order in mind. Fingers crossed for availability 🤞😉
items.content_text: Checked out four different local parks with my son to stack rank for his upcoming birthday party. The rain was not an issue and we now have a clear order in mind. Fingers crossed for availability 🤞😉

items.content_text: Spent some time outside doing spring yard work after work today. Perfect late afternoon/evening for it!

items.content_html: Still feeling sore after my race Saturday. That didn’t stop me from getting out for a walk with my wife and the dogs today. 🌞

items.content_html: Ran the Storm the Park 50K. Very hilly and technical, but a fun race on a beautiful day.
items.content_text: Ran the Storm the Park 50K. Very hilly and technical, but a fun race on a beautiful day.

items.content_html: Got my last run 🏃in before the Storm the Park 50K today. I’m excited for the long run with some terrain and vert. 8000+ feet of elevation coming for my 50K…
items.content_text: Got my last run 🏃in before the [Storm the Park 50K](https://www.stormsportingevents.org/event-details/storm-the-park) today. I'm excited for the long run with some terrain and vert. 8000+ feet of elevation coming for my 50K...

items.content_html:
First time trying a Jalapeño IPA. Birch’s on the Lake in Long Lake had it. Good spiciness 🌶️ but still easy to drink.

Was out with the Tuesday Night Trails group and got to chat with Isaac, the new primary owner of Gear West. Excited for their future!
items.content_text: First time trying a Jalapeño IPA. Birch's on the Lake in Long Lake had it. Good spiciness 🌶️ but still easy to drink. Was out with the Tuesday Night Trails group and got to chat with Isaac, the new primary owner of Gear West. Excited for their future!

items.content_html:
Returned the kids' seasonal ski rental gear today. It was a fantastic season with lots of growth for both of them!

It’s also a nice milestone to mark the changing of seasons. ❄️ 🌦️ 🌞

items.content_html: At 8:02am today, Xfinity texted me about internet outages until 6pm because of “Service Improvements”. Really wish I had notice before the work day. Grateful I could rush into my local office to do my scheduled presentations. 🙄

items.content_html: Pontoon update–we have a deal! Working through the payment and title transfer process, then will have a few things done (removal of trolling motor, re-installation of the bimini and front gate, cleaning) before we take delivery. We’re excited!
items.content_text: Pontoon update--we have a deal! Working through the payment and title transfer process, then will have a few things done (removal of trolling motor, re-installation of the bimini and front gate, cleaning) before we take delivery. We're excited!

items.content_html: My wife and I have been eyeing new (to us) pontoons to replace the one we have that’s from 1986. Our timing may be perfect…within an hour of chatting with the guy who stores our current boat, he learned of a friend who needs to sell his boat that fits our needs very well. Checking it out tomorrow!

items.content_html: I love running at the Stahl’s Lake Trails. They wind and weave crisscrossing in a way that just feels good. Mostly single track, I can get 6 miles in this little park without doubling any one section. 🏃❄️☁️

items.content_html: Spent a good 3 hours pondering different aspects of some of my upcoming races for the year. I’m thinking about several, but the Kettle Moraine 100k has taken the most mindshare. It’ll be my longest race so far. While I’m confident I’ll be ready, it’s still taking up a fair bit of headspace.

items.content_html: I primarily use Windows for my day-to-day, and Obsidian may be useful for my blogging workflow. Giving it a shot with the micro.publish plugin. This is a test, it is only a test (though I’ll keep it here for posterity).

items.content_html: Despite being a bit slippery in some spots, it was a gorgeous morning for my run. It was really cool seeing the ground shimmer and sparkle like something out of a video game. Tough to capture in a still-shot but as I ran it was like a million mini sparkling lights ✨

items.content_html: Listened to the Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenov on the Hard Fork podcast… Was unimpressed and he squandered an opportunity to build trust 👎. Instead it was more like listening to a pure fanboy that’s unwilling to acknowledge any grey area. Episode: Hard Fork podcast, interview starts at ~25:05
items.content_text: Listened to the Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenov on the Hard Fork podcast... Was unimpressed and he squandered an opportunity to build trust  👎. Instead it was more like listening to a pure fanboy that's unwilling to acknowledge any grey area. Episode: [Hard Fork podcast, interview starts at ~25:05](https://open.spotify.com/episode/2vCQLdOb6MN7LBqvpBxhFb?si=1MkEMgQBRpy7AUn2cPcgnA&t=1503708)

items.content_html: After mentioning my journal, I thought I’d post a link to the publisher of my 10-year journal…but they appear to be out of business! ☹️ I have a couple of years before I need my next volume, but it’s sad to see they last published in 2022. –Journal10
items.content_text: After mentioning my journal, I thought I'd post a link to the publisher of my 10-year journal...but they appear to be out of business! ☹️ I have a couple of years before I *need* my next volume, but it's sad to see they last published in 2022. --[Journal10](https://www.journal10.com/)

items.content_html:
Productive day in the cold:

  • worked with the fam on some tidying projects
  • cleaned some food out of the pantry that’s been there long enough
  • played some Uno Flip with my daughter
  • updated my navigation and social links on my personal website matthewcanderson.com
  • caught up on my paper journal
items.content_text:
Productive day in the cold:

- worked with the fam on some tidying projects
- cleaned some food out of the pantry that's been there long enough
- played some Uno Flip with my daughter
- updated my navigation and social links on my personal website [matthewcanderson.com](https://www.matthewcanderson.com)
- caught up on my [paper journal](https://www.matthewcanderson.com/reflecting-on-4000-daily-journals/)

items.content_html: Another one of those chilly days today… Grateful to have a nice warm home and the choice to stay in.
items.content_text: Another one of those chilly days today... Grateful to have a nice warm home and the choice to stay in.

items.content_html: Got out for a nice 🌞🏃 today, even though it’s cold out there. Wrapping a light mileage week after a race, feeling stronger each day, will continue ramping this week.
items.content_text: Got out for a nice 🌞🏃 today, even though it's cold out there. Wrapping a light mileage week after a race, feeling stronger each day, will continue ramping this week.

items.content_html: Boys will be boys (watching USA Vs Canada hockey)
items.content_text: Boys will be boys (watching USA Vs Canada hockey)

items.content_html: Cub Scouts ice fishing day was a bust, but H said “that’s okay…let’s make our own fun.” So we did 🌞
items.content_text: Cub Scouts ice fishing day was a bust, but H said "that's okay...let's make our own fun." So we did 🌞

items.content_html: Watched The Instigators 🍿👍
items.content_text: Watched [The Instigators](https://www.themoviedb.org/movie/1059064-the-instigators) 🍿👍

items.content_html: I’ve started back into A Crown of Swords by Robert Jordan 📚 I’d made good progress through book 6 of the series, but paused a couple of years back when I changed roles at work. Excited to be back at it.
items.content_text: I've started back into [A Crown of Swords](https://micro.blog/books/9781250252081) by Robert Jordan 📚 I'd made good progress through book 6 of the series, but paused a couple of years back when I changed roles at work. Excited to be back at it.

items.content_html: I felt ready to get out running again today… my Garmin agreed (after a couple days at 1 then 19). It’s a lot colder out back home in Minny compared to Arizona. Still glad to get back out there!
items.content_text: I felt ready to get out running again today... my Garmin agreed (after a couple days at 1 then 19). It's a lot colder out back home in Minny compared to Arizona. Still glad to get back out there!

items.content_html: I’m hoping I’ll be recovered enough to get out running tomorrow. Signs are good based on the game of tag with my kids tonight 🌞
items.content_text: I'm hoping I'll be recovered enough to get out running tomorrow. Signs are good based on the game of tag with my kids tonight 🌞

items.content_html: Using the recovery room at my running gym. Normatec sleeves have been a great help to get my legs get back to normal after a race.
items.content_text: Using the recovery room at my running gym. Normatec sleeves have been a great help to get my legs get back to normal after a race.

items.content_html: Ran the Black Canyon Ultras 50K today! What a blast..but now I’m exhausted 🎽🏃‍➡️🪨🚀🍕🍗🏈🥣🛌
items.content_text: Ran the Black Canyon Ultras 50K today! What a blast..but now I'm exhausted 🎽🏃‍➡️🪨🚀🍕🍗🏈🥣🛌

items.content_html: Hiking near Sedona is really pretty… This is Red Rock Secret Mountain
items.content_text: Hiking near Sedona is really pretty... This is Red Rock Secret Mountain

items.content_html: I was today years old when I first saw the Grand Canyon in person. Wow.
items.content_text: I was today years old when I first saw the Grand Canyon in person. Wow.

items.title: First Post
items.content_html:
Welcome to my corner of the internet! This is my very first post on Micro.blog, and I’m thrilled to start this journey with you all. 🌟

A little about me: I’m passionate about making memories with my kids, and I love sharing my thoughts and experiences on technology, running, and random thoughts.

Why Micro.blog? I’m choosing this platform because of its simplicity and the wonderful community it fosters. I’m hoping that Micro.blog will let me radically simplify my posting process and give me an outlet for little notes that aren’t longer blog posts. It’s a place where I can share my ideas, connect with like-minded individuals, and grow as a writer and creator.

Stay tuned for more posts, and feel free to reach out and say hi! Let’s embark on this adventure together.
items.content_text:
